description: Neither in the site nor in the interface did I find a simple how-to. Trying to load recoveries throws errors. It might be good, but it doesn't tell you how to use it.

I'm grateful that this is available as an alternative to ODIN, so I can use Linux full-time. The only downside is I have to look up instructions; but then again, I should know what I'm using this for anyways.
summary: Very useful for loading custom ROMs!

description: Trial and error will get you to know the app. I wish it was more like Odin, so it can be a drop-in replacement, with maybe an "Advanced" panel that gives you the granularity that Heimdall provides.
Was able to flash a custom recovery for my Samsung J7 Prime
I use larger text via the accessibility menu in GNOME and for whatever reason I cannot resize Heimdall like every other application I use, so everything is squished and unreadable. :(
Only managed to make it work when flashing twrp recovery img
